channel.title: How does imgur handle external image loading? [Related question]
channel.description:
So, for all of you that don't happen to know the site, [url=http://www.imgur.com]imgur[/url] is a very popular image hosting site (esp. for reddit users). If you ever browse the images on the site, and read the comments. Some comments contain links that end with .png, .gif, .jpg. The common image links. Now, if you click these links, the image loads on the page, no matter the origin, it just needs to be a direct image link. I was wondering how they got that to work. I'm not at home, and my school blocks imgur for adult oriented content (hahaha), and I'm trying to do something similar.
On a related note to above. I want to make a webpage (already made), and populate it (not done) with a bunch of swf's of my work. The catch here is I want them to each load on the same page (like imgur does), so I don't need to populate 50 pages for each individual swf.
Help please?

item.title: How does imgur handle external image loading? [Related question]

Fancybox
[/quote]Haha.

???[/quote]Think dirty.

item.source: How does imgur handle external image loading? [Related question]

item.title: How does imgur handle external image loading? [Related question]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:499859”]Just a simple JavaScript/jQuery plugin I imagine, I’ve used one very similar here called Fancybox.

Regarding the second part, first of all, any reason to use the SWF format?
If they were similar pages with slightly different content for example, I would store the content/link/media (though I wouldn’t advise storing the actual media itself) in a database, then create the pages dynamically using query strings, e.g. www.example.com/work?item=swfObject43.

Though I’m sure it would be possible to modify the above plugin to also work with the SWF format, if you absolutely have to…
Iirc, just remembered, I think it has the ability to display an entire webpage in one of the popout boxes, so I don’t see why not.

Haha, had to laugh at their style sheet naming: http://s.imgur.com/include/css/ie-sucks.css[/quote]
Oh my god it’s really named that??

And I don’t see any other format a flash element could used on the web. My teacher wanted me to make a site that contains all the stuff I’ve worked on in AS3 and junk, so yeah.

Edit:
http://fancyapps.com/fancybox/#examples
They have it made for SWF

Read full topic
item.source: How does imgur handle external image loading? [Related question]

item.title: How does imgur handle external image loading? [Related question]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Just a simple JavaScript/jQuery plugin I imagine, I’ve used one very similar here called Fancybox.

Regarding the second part, first of all, any reason to use the SWF format?
If they were similar pages with slightly different content for example, I would store the content/link/media (though I wouldn’t advise storing the actual media itself) in a database, then create the pages dynamically using query strings, e.g. www.example.com/work?item=swfObject43.

Though I’m sure it would be possible to modify the above plugin to also work with the SWF format, if you absolutely have to…
Iirc, just remembered, I think it has the ability to display an entire webpage in one of the popout boxes, so I don’t see why not.

Haha, had to laugh at their style sheet naming: http://s.imgur.com/include/css/ie-sucks.css

Read full topic
